climbs.name: Little Potato Route
climbs.fa: Adam Vidoni, Dave Bartelme, Nate Suurmeyer, Alan Wilson

content.description:
Route starts up a thin crack system, that offers minimal protection. The route comes to point where it gets less steep and requires some friction up to the top roof structure which has the appearance and shape of a bergschrund made of rock. Pulling over this roof will get you to the anchors and a  nice belay ledge.

Anchors are accessible by hiking around from west side, and most likely the east side.
content.protection: Probably could use some bolts on the first 30 feet. Anchors at the top, located at 42.542495, -107.555862 .
content.location:
The start is just to the right of a small tree growing out of the rocks.

Descent can be done using one 70m rope, anything shorter will leave you hanging.

content.description: Starts to the right of a small tree at the same place as the Little Potato Route. However, instead of following the thin cracks of the Little Potato Route, Addy's Chimney will follow the chimney system farther to the right. The chimney is impossible to protect, but lends for easy stemming and chimney-ing. Once above the Chimney, the route follows a friction section up to a small roof and then over to the anchors.
content.protection: Some bolts should be installed below. Small gear up top
content.location:
42.542495, -107.555862

Can rap of the rap rings using a 70m rope
